ilo: Select and organise a range of research-informed teaching and relational strategies to support student participation within safe and sustainable school communities.

Plan professional learning goals through critical reflection on how to use evidence-informed strategies to advance the physical, social, and cognitive capabilities of students to provide inclusive learning environments for all.
Implement a range of research-informed interpersonal and communicative strategies to effectively manage challenging behaviour and maintain student safety.

Compare and review effective methods through which to engage parents and carers on matters affecting student wellbeing and engagement to meet professional ethics and legislative, administrative and organisational responsibilities.
generic_skills: Responsiveness to a changing knowledge base.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Report: Written report on collaborative learning strategies
Script: Annotated script of a conversation for a student wellbeing issue

assessment.hurdle: A minimum of 80% attendance at, or engagement with, all sessions identified as contact hours (may include lectures, tutorials, seminars and workshops, both synchronous and asynchronous).

date_times.contact_hours: 24 hours (16 hours of on-campus classes and 8 hours of asynchronous online activities).
24 hours (16 hours of on-campus classes and 8 hours of asynchronous online activities)
